p: The concentration and total flavonoid content of I. sinensis were determined as 0.043 mg/ml, 10.74 Â± 0.25 mg/g, respectively. Although far lower than most species of filicinae, a little higher than that of selaginella and equisetums [ 18], and higher than the total flavonoid content of bryophytes [ 19]. Primitive plant groups might have lower flavonoid contents than their modern counterparts.
